content:
Welcome to my blog! # This first post is not very eventful. It merely serves to fill my blog with some content for me to ensure that everything is up and running properly when it comes online.
Have a great day! 😄
title: Welcome

content:
The Waughness ✋ #Observe these equations:
$$\begin{aligned} G_{\mu\nu}+\Lambda g_{\mu\nu}=R_{\mu\nu}-\frac{1}{2}Rg_{\mu\nu}+\Lambda g_{\mu\nu}=\frac{8\pi G}{c^{4}}T_{\mu\nu}=\kappa T_{\mu\nu} \end{aligned}$$
These are the Einstein Field Equations, which relate the geometry of spacetime to the distribution of energy and matter within it 😉. However, one may express the Dirac equation in its simplest and most compact form üò≤:
\begin{equation} \left(i\cancel{\partial}-m\right)\psi=0 \end{equation}
From equation \((1)\), one may eagerly postulate the existence of a quote from the exalted ones in their quest for expressively mechanized, repressive sublimination:
Do not believe everything you read on the internet, especially from a Miles.
‚Äî Albert Einstein
But by considering the cook of the bacon and the bake of the cookie, you arrive with the following algorithm for computing \(\pi\):
Compression of the Supression (and Other Non-sensical Components) #Deriving Hyperform Rhombic-Dodecahedral Quadrature From Their Associated P-Values #Musical Operators in Differential Geometry #North and South #Polynomial Time Series #Extraordinary Convergence #Head/Tail Breaks #Taking Over the World, Conspicuously #
summary: A post to use as a realistic demo.
title: Demo Post

content:
Top Level Header # Warning! This post is my first and serves as a demo! It contains no “real” content in a sense. The following is a list. üòÄ
Bullets And Such Also,
Alphabetized Numbered Because Numbers are nice And if needed:
Done ‚úÖ Done Todo Not done ‚ùå Quotes are pretty dope ngl
‚Äî Albert Einstein. üòâ
Term Definition. Another definition. And so ==this right here== is not highlighted. Didn’t really need it. H2O and x^2^ (apparently do not work without \(\LaTeX\)).
Well let’s have a section divider.
Header Level 2 #Ok but
Even Smaller Header #There’s Bold and italic and Both. Of course, code:
import numpy as np arr = np.arange(1, 10) arr = arr * arr - 3 * arr - 1 print(arr) output:
[-3 -3 -1 3 9 17 27 39 53] You can see that i iterates from 0 to 10 in the loop, but the lower bound is inclusive while the upper bound is exclusive. The print function also adds a new line by default!^[1]
Check out these nice equations üòÄ:
$$\begin{aligned} G_{\mu\nu}+\Lambda g_{\mu\nu}=R_{\mu\nu}-\frac{1}{2}Rg_{\mu\nu}+\Lambda g_{\mu\nu}=\frac{8\pi G}{c^{4}}T_{\mu\nu}=\kappa T_{\mu\nu} \end{aligned}$$
$$\begin{aligned} G_{\mu\nu}+\Lambda g_{\mu\nu}=R_{\mu\nu}-\frac{1}{2}Rg_{\mu\nu}+\Lambda g_{\mu\nu}=\frac{8\pi G}{c^{4}}T_{\mu\nu}=\kappa T_{\mu\nu} \end{aligned}$$ \begin{equation} \left(i\cancel{\partial}-m\right)\psi=0 \end{equation}
\begin{equation} \left(i\cancel{\partial}-m\right)\psi=0 \end{equation} \begin{equation} \left(i\cancel{\partial}-m\right)\psi=0 \end{equation}
Automatic numbering!! Nice.
$$\vec{F}=\dot{\vec{p}}=m\ddot{\vec{x}}$$
$$\vec{F}=\dot{\vec{p}}=m\ddot{\vec{x}}$$ Inline math: \(\varphi = \dfrac{1+\sqrt5}{2}= 1.6180339887‚Ä¶\)
Inline math: \\(\varphi = \dfrac{1+\sqrt5}{2}= 1.6180339887‚Ä¶\\) Block math: $$ \varphi = 1+\frac{1} {1+\frac{1} {1+\frac{1} {1+\cdots} } } $$
Block math: $$ \varphi = 1+\frac{1} {1+\frac{1} {1+\frac{1} {1+\cdots} } } $$ Check out this table with \(\vec{E}\) and \(V\):
Point Line Plane $$\vec{E}$$ $$k\frac{Q}{r^{2}}$$ $$\frac{\lambda}{2\pi\epsilon_{0}r}$$ $$\frac{\sigma}{2e_{0}}$$ $$V$$ $$k\frac{Q}{r}$$ $$\frac{\lambda\ln\left(r\right)}{2\pi\epsilon_{0}}$$ $$\frac{\sigma}{2\epsilon_{0}}r$$ Smallest Header #Check out this quintic hyperellipse:
